  • Method Details

    • registerUserVisitant

      public String registerUserVisitant(String userName, String password)
      The function registers a user visitant by creating a new Visitant object with the given username and password, adding it to a list of users, and returning a success message.
      Parameters:
      userName - The username of the visitant that is being registered. It is a String value.
      password - The password parameter is a String that represents the password chosen by the user visitant during registration.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a string message stating that the user visitant was registered.

    • registerUserInformationCollector

      public String registerUserInformationCollector(String userName, String password, String name, String email, String phone)
      The function registers a user information collector by creating an instance of the InformationCollector class and adding it to a list of users.
      Parameters:
      userName - The username of the user information collector. It is used to uniquely identify the user.
      password - The password parameter is a String that represents the password of the user.
      name - The name parameter is a String that represents the name of the user.
      email - The email parameter is a string that represents the email address of the user.
      phone - The "phone" parameter is a String that represents the phone number of the user.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a string message stating that the user information collector was registered.

    • registerUserResearcher

      public String registerUserResearcher(String userName, String password, String name, String email, String phone, String areaU, String charge)
      The function registers a user researcher by creating a new Researcher object and adding it to a list of users.
      Parameters:
      userName - The username of the researcher being registered.
      password - The password parameter is a String that represents the password for the researcher's account.
      name - The name parameter is a String that represents the name of the researcher.
      email - The email parameter is a string that represents the email address of the researcher being registered.
      phone - The "phone" parameter is a string that represents the phone number of the researcher being registered.
      areaU - The "areaU" parameter represents the area of expertise of the researcher. It could be a specific field or subject that the researcher specializes in.
      charge - The "charge" parameter refers to the position or role of the researcher. It could be their job title or the specific role they have within their research field.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a string message stating that the user researcher was registered.

    • identifyVisitant

      public boolean identifyVisitant(String userName)
      The function checks if a user with a given username is a visitant.
      Parameters:
      userName - The parameter "userName" is a String that represents the username of a user.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a boolean value. It returns true if there is a user with the given username who is an instance of the Visitant class. Otherwise, it returns false.

    • identifyInformationCollector

      public boolean identifyInformationCollector(String userName)
      The function checks if a user with a given username is an instance of the InformationCollector class.
      Parameters:
      userName - The username of the user we want to check if they are an InformationCollector.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a boolean value. It returns true if there is a user with the given username who is an instance of the InformationCollector class. Otherwise, it returns false.

    • identifyResearcher

      public boolean identifyResearcher(String userName)
      The function checks if a user with a given username is a researcher.
      Parameters:
      userName - The username of the user we want to check if they are a researcher.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a boolean value. It returns true if there is a user with the given username who is also an instance of the Researcher class. Otherwise, it returns false.

    • secureStatus

      public boolean secureStatus(String status)
      The function takes a status as input and returns true if the status is "active", false if the status is "inactive", and throws an exception if the status is invalid.
      Parameters:
      status - The status parameter is a string that represents the current status. It can be either "active" or "inactive".
      Returns:
      The method is returning a boolean value. If the status is "active", it will return true. If the status is "inactive", it will return false. If the status is neither "active" nor "inactive", it will throw an IllegalArgumentException.

    • securePillar

      public boolean securePillar(String pillar)
      The function "securePillar" checks if a given string matches one of the four specified pillars and returns true if it does, otherwise it returns false.
      Parameters:
      pillar - A string representing the pillar to be checked for security.
      Returns:
      The method `securePillar` returns a boolean value.

    • registerProject

      public String registerProject(String pillar, String status, String name, String id, String description, String starDate, String finalDate)
      The function `registerProject` creates a new project with the given parameters and adds it to the appropriate pillar based on the provided pillar name.
      Parameters:
      pillar - The pillar parameter represents the category or area of focus for the project. It can be one of the following values: "biodiversity", "water", "waste treatment", or "energy".
      status - The status of the project (e.g. "active", "inactive").
      name - The name of the project.
      id - The "id" parameter is a unique identifier for the project. It is used to distinguish one project from another.
      description - The description parameter is a String that represents the description of the project. It provides additional information about the project and its goals.
      starDate - The start date of the project.
      finalDate - The finalDate parameter is the date when the project is expected to be completed or finished.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a string message "The project was created successfully!\n".

    • loginUser

      public boolean loginUser(String userName, String password)
      The function loginUser takes in a username and password, checks if the username exists in the list of users, and if it does, calls the login method of that user with the given username and password.
      Parameters:
      userName - The username entered by the user trying to log in.
      password - The password parameter is a String that represents the password entered by the user trying to log in.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a boolean value. It returns true if the user is successfully logged in, and false if the user is not found or the password is incorrect.

    • listProjects

      public String listProjects(String pillar)
      The function "listProjects" takes a pillar as input and returns a string containing the names of the projects associated with that pillar.
      Parameters:
      pillar - The parameter "pillar" is a String that represents the type of pillar. It can have one of the following values: "biodiversity", "water", "waste treatment", or "energy".
      Returns:
      The method is returning a string message that lists the names of the projects under the specified pillar.

    • listAtributesProject

      public String listAtributesProject(String nameP)
      The function "listAtributesProject" takes a project name as input and returns the attributes of the project if it exists, otherwise it returns an empty string.
      Parameters:
      nameP - The name of the project you want to list the attributes for.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a string representation of the attributes of a project with the given name. If a project with the given name is found, the method returns the string representation of the project's attributes using the `toStringImprove()` method. If no project with the given name is found, an empty string is returned.

    • modifyProject

      public String modifyProject(String nameP, String atribute, String newAt)
      The function modifies a project's attribute based on the given name and attribute, and returns a success message.
      Parameters:
      nameP - The name of the project you want to modify.
      atribute - The attribute parameter is used to specify which attribute of the project needs to be modified. It can take the following values:
      newAt - The new value for the specified attribute.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a string message indicating that the modification was successful.

    • deleteProject

      public String deleteProject(String pillar, String nameP)
      The function deletes a project from a specific pillar.
      Parameters:
      pillar - The pillar parameter is a String that represents the type of pillar where the project is located.
      nameP - The name of the project that you want to delete.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a string message. If the project is successfully deleted, it will return "The project was deleted successfully!\n". If the project is not found, it will return "The project wasn't found\n".

    • verifyEvidenceCollector

      public boolean verifyEvidenceCollector(String type)
      The function `verifyEvidenceCollector` checks if the given type is "review" and returns true, otherwise it returns false.
      Parameters:
      type - A string representing the type of evidence collector.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a boolean value. If the type is "review", it will return true. If the type is "file" or any other value, it will return false.

    • addEvidence

      public String addEvidence(String pillar, String nameP, String name, String description, String date, String type, String typeFile, String url, String userName, String status)
      The function "addEvidence" adds evidence to a project based on the user's role (information collector or researcher).
      Parameters:
      pillar - The pillar is a String that represents the category or domain of the project or evidence. It could be something like "Education", "Healthcare", "Environment", etc.
      nameP - The name of the project where the evidence will be added.
      name - The name parameter represents the name of the evidence being added.
      description - The description parameter is a String that represents the description of the evidence being added.
      date - The date parameter is a string that represents the date when the evidence was added.
      type - The "type" parameter represents the type of evidence being added, such as "document", "image", "video", etc.
      typeFile - The parameter "typeFile" represents the file type of the evidence being added. It could be a string value such as "pdf", "jpg", "docx", etc.
      url - The "url" parameter is a string that represents the URL or file path of the evidence being added. It is used to specify the location of the evidence file or resource.
      userName - The username of the person adding the evidence.
      status - The "status" parameter is used to indicate the status of the evidence being added. It could be a string value representing the current status of the evidence, such as "pending", "approved", "rejected", etc.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String message indicating whether the evidence was added successfully or not.

    • listCaracteristicsEvidencesProject

      public String listCaracteristicsEvidencesProject(String pillar, String nameP, String nameE)
      The function searches for a specific evidence in a project within a given pillar and returns its characteristics.
      Parameters:
      pillar - The pillar is a String representing the category or domain of the project. It is used to search for the specific project within that pillar.
      nameP - The name of the project you want to search for evidence in.
      nameE - The name of the evidence you are searching for.
      Returns:
      The method is returning either the string representation of the evidence object if it is found, or the message "The evidence wasn't found" if it is not found.

    • listEvidences

      public String listEvidences()
      The function "listEvidences" iterates through a list of pillars, projects, and evidence to generate a message containing the names of all the evidence.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a string that contains the names of all the evidences in the projects. If there are no evidences, it will return a message stating that the project doesn't have any evidences yet.

    • modifyEvidenceProject

      public String modifyEvidenceProject(String nameE, String caract, String newC)
      The function modifies the evidence of a project by searching for it in a list of pillars and projects.
      Parameters:
      nameE - The name of the evidence project that you want to modify.
      caract - The parameter "caract" is a string that represents the characteristic or attribute of the evidence that you want to modify.
      newC - The new value that you want to set for the specified characteristic of the evidence project.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String message.

    • removeEvidenceProject

      public String removeEvidenceProject(String pillar, String nameP, String nameE)
      The function removes evidence from a project within a specific pillar.
      Parameters:
      pillar - The pillar parameter is a String that represents the type of pillar.
      nameP - The name of the project from which you want to remove evidence.
      nameE - The name of the evidence that you want to remove from the project.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a string message. If the evidence was successfully deleted, it returns "The evidence was deleted successfully!\n". If the evidence was not found, it returns "The evidence wasn't found\n".

    • addInterestPoint

      public String addInterestPoint(String nameI, ArrayList<String> nameE, int x, int y, String nameP, String pillar)
      The function adds an interest point to a map based on specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      nameI - The name of the interest point to be added.
      nameE - nameE is an ArrayList of Strings that represents the names of the evidence items.
      x - The x-coordinate of the interest point on the map.
      y - The parameter "y" represents the y-coordinate of the interest point on the map.
      nameP - The name of the project that the interest point belongs to.
      pillar - The parameter "pillar" is a String that represents the type of pillar.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a string message indicating whether the interest point was added successfully or not.

    • getMap

      public String getMap()
      The function `getMap()` returns a string representation of a map, where each cell contains information about the evidence present in that location.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String representation of the map.

    • listStatusEvidences

      public String listStatusEvidences()
      The function "listStatusEvidences" returns a string containing the names of all pending reviews.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a string that contains the names of the reviews that have a status of false. If there are no reviews with a false status, it will return the message "There aren't evidences pending".

    • listCaracteristicsInterestP

      public String listCaracteristicsInterestP(int row, int column)
      The function "listCaracteristicsInterestP" returns the characteristics of an interest point at a given row and column in a map.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index of the interest point in the map array.
      column - The column parameter represents the column index of the interest point in the map.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a string that contains the characteristics of an interest point. If the interest point exists at the specified row and column in the map, the method returns the name, X and Y coordinates, and a label for evidences. If the interest point does not exist, the method returns a message stating that the interest point was not found.

    • modifyInterestPoints

      public String modifyInterestPoints(String caract, String pillar, String nameP, ArrayList<String> nameE, String newC, int xy, int row, int column)
      The function modifies various properties of an interest point in a map based on the given parameters.
      Parameters:
      caract - The parameter "caract" is a string that represents the characteristic of the interest point that you want to modify. It can be "name", "ubication x", "ubication y", or "evidences".
      pillar - The parameter "pillar" is a String that represents the type of pillar associated with the interest point.
      nameP - The name of the project to which the interest point belongs.
      nameE - An ArrayList of Strings representing the names of the evidences to be added to the interest point.
      newC - The new value for the specified characteristic (e.g., name, ubication x, ubication y).
      xy - The parameter "xy" represents the new value for the x or y coordinate of the interest point's location. It is used to update the ubicationX or ubicationY property of the interest point.
      row - The row parameter represents the row index of the interest point in the map array.
      column - The column parameter represents the column index of the interest point in the map.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String message indicating the result of the modification. It will return "The modify was successfully!" if the modification was successful, or it will return an error message if an invalid option was entered or if there is already an interest point in the specified location.

    • removeInterestPoint

      public String removeInterestPoint(int row, int column)
      The removeInterestPoint function removes an interest point from a map at the specified row and column.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index of the interest point to be removed from the map.
      column - The column parameter represents the column index of the interest point that you want to remove.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a string message indicating that the interest point was deleted successfully.

    • listProjectsFilterPillar

      public String listProjectsFilterPillar(String pillar)
      The function "listInterestPointsFilterPillar" takes a pillar as input and returns a sorted list of interest points that belong to that pillar.
      Parameters:
      pillar - The parameter "pillar" is a String that represents the type of pillar for filtering the interest points.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a string that contains the names of interest points that match the specified pillar. If there are no interest points that match the pillar, the method returns a message stating that there are no interest points.

    • setCommentsInterestPoint

      public String setCommentsInterestPoint(String comments, int row, int column)
      The function sets comments for a specific interest point on a map.
      Parameters:
      comments - A string representing the comments to be added to the interest point.
      row - The row parameter represents the row index of the interest point in the map array.
      column - The column parameter represents the column index of the interest point in the map. It is used to locate the specific interest point in the map array.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a string message indicating that the comments were added successfully.

    • testCases

      public void testCases()
      The testCases() function creates instances of different classes, registers projects, adds evidence, and adds interest points.

    • listEvidencesProject

      public String listEvidencesProject(String pillar, String nameP)
      The function "listEvidencesProject" returns a string containing information about a project, including its name, id, description, status, start date, final date, and the quantity of reviews and files associated with it.
      Parameters:
      pillar - The pillar parameter is a String that represents the type of pillar. It is used to filter the projects based on the pillar type.
      nameP - The name of the project for which you want to list the evidences.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a string that contains the information of a project, including its name, id, description, status, start date, and final date. It also includes the quantity of reviews and files associated with the project.

    • listCaracteristicsInterestPShow

      public String listCaracteristicsInterestPShow(int row, int column)
      The function "listCaracteristicsInterestPShow" returns the characteristics of an interest point at a given row and column in a map, or a message indicating that the interest point was not found.
      Parameters:
      row - The row parameter represents the row index of the interest point in the map array.
      column - The column parameter represents the column index of the interest point in the map.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a string that contains the characteristics of an interest point at the specified row and column in a map. If an interest point is found at that location, the method returns the name, X and Y coordinates, evidences, and QR code of the interest point. If no interest point is found, the method returns a message stating that the interest point wasn't found.
